original: Jungkvist, Sigfrid Emanuel, lektor, Skövde, f. 15/2/89 i Växjö av Johan J. o. Matilda Johansson. G. 13 m. Ester Lindberg. Barn: Ragnar f. 14, tf. stadsfogde, Skövde, Tot 22, jur. stud. — Stud:ex. i Växjö 09, fil. mag. i Upps. 11, fil. Hc. 30, fil. dr 31, jur. kand. 33, provår 14. Resa t. Pommern f. stud. av totala solförmörk. där 12. Lär. i Ulricehamn 12, timlär. v. Upps. h. a. 1. 14-15, e. lär. i Örnsköldsvik 16, Vänersb. 22, vik. adj. i Borås 23, e. lär. där 24-26, vik. adj. v. östra real i Sthlm 23-24, e. lär. i Umeå 29, vik. adj. där s. å., timlär. v. Upps. ensk. rärov. 30-31, AUS 30-31, m. full tjg. 31-32, assist, v. astron. observat. i Upps. 30-31, lektor i matem. o. fysik v. Skövde h. a. 1. sed. 31. Har därjämte idkat jordbr. o. bedr. sågverksrör., hu-v:sakl. å Fenneslunda sät. i Älvsb. 1., 17-28. Smål. nat. i Upps. andre kur. 15, led. av liärov. lokalisityr. 33’, skiftes-godeman, ordf. i nykterh :nd, led. av fastigh :tax:nd, lantbr :omb. i Södra Älvsb. 1. hush :sällsk., led. av Skövde hyresnd 4i2;-43i, inneh. av Jungkvisits jur. byrå sed. 34, ombud f. Sthlms, Gbgs m. fl. köpmannafören. Skr.: A study of stars in the open duster N. G. C. 752 and its surroundings (grad:-avh. 31). Hobby: trädgårdsodling.
translated: Jungkvist, Sigfrid Emanuel, lecturer, Skövde, born February 15, 1889 in Växjö to Johan J. and Matilda Johansson. Married to Ester Lindberg in 1913. Children: Ragnar, born 1914, temporary city administrator in Skövde, law student until 1922. Education: high school diploma in Växjö in 1909, Bachelor of Arts in Uppsala in 1911, Master of Arts in 1930, Doctor of Philosophy in 1931, law degree in 1933, one year of practical training in 1914. Traveled to Pomerania during a total solar eclipse in 1912 to study. Career: teacher in Ulricehamn in 1912, temporary teacher in Uppsala's higher girls' school in 1914-1915, permanent teacher in Örnsköldsvik in 1916, in Vänersborg in 1922, substitute teacher in Borås in 1923, permanent teacher there from 1924-1926, substitute teacher in eastern real school in Stockholm in 1923-1924, permanent teacher in Umeå in 1929, substitute teacher there in the same year, part-time teacher in Uppsala's private navigation school in 1930-1931, astronomer in the Swedish meteorological and hydrological institute in 1930-1931, lecturer in mathematics and physics at Skövde from autumn 1931. In addition, he engaged in agriculture and operated a sawmill, and was a member of several committees and societies. He was the second curator of Smålands nation in Uppsala in 1915, member of the studying committee for the localization of upper secondary schools in 1933, land commissioner, chairman of temperance society, member of the real estate tax committee, member of the agriculture committee in Southern Älvsborg, member of the Skövde tenant association from 1942-1943, and owned the Jungkvist law firm from 1934. He was an agent for several merchant associations in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and elsewhere. He wrote a thesis called "A Study of Stars in the Open Cluster N. G. C. 752 and Its Surroundings" in 1931. Hobby: gardening.

memberOf.name: Studying Committee for the Localization of Upper Secondary Schools

thesis.name: A Study of Stars in the Open Cluster N. G. C. 752 and Its Surroundings
